devdoc.author: Angle Core Team
devdoc.details: The exchange rate between sanTokens and collateral will automatically change as interests and transaction fees accrue to SLPsThere is one `SanToken` contract per pair stablecoin/collateral

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burnFrom(uint256,address,address).details: Only the `StableMaster` can call this function

params.burner: Address to burn from and to redeem collateral to

burnSelf(uint256,address).details: This can only be called by the `StableMaster` which performs all the security checks to see for instance if the `burner` was the initial `msg.sender`

params.amount: Amount of sanTokens to burn from caller

decimals().details: For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`)Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._poolManager: Reference to the `PoolManager` contract associated to this `SanToken`

mint(address,uint256).details: Only the `StableMaster` contract can issue sanTokensThere is no need to make this function pausable (as well as the `StableMaster` functions below) as the corresponding function can directly be paused from the `StableMaster`

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

devdoc.title: SanToken

burnFrom(uint256,address,address).notice: Lets a `sender` address burn sanTokens from another `burner` address

burnNoRedeem(uint256).notice: Destroys `amount` token for the caller without giving collateral back

decimal().notice: Number of decimals used for this ERC20

decimals().notice: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.

poolManager().notice: Address of the corresponding `PoolManager` contract This address cannot be modified Although it is not used in the functions of the contract, this address is stored in order to make sure that there cannot be a shared sanToken for multiple `PoolManager` contracts

stableMaster().notice: Address of the corresponding `StableMaster` contract This address cannot be modified

userdoc.notice: Base contract for sanTokens, these tokens are used to mark the debt the contract has to SLPs
